item.title: Beth add a quote by Elizabeth Berg
item.description: "Sometimes you know before you know." -- Elizabeth Berg

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "The desire to never leave your side, the desire to never see you again. The desire to see your face asleep on the pillow beside my face and to see your eyes open in the morning when I lie next to you—just watching you, waiting for you to wake up." -- John Irving

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "Your memory is a monster; you forget—it doesn't. It simply files things away. It keeps things for you, or hides things from you—and summons them to your recall with will of its own. You think you have a memory; but it has you!" -- John Irving

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "All his life he would hold this moment as exemplary of what love was. It was not wanting anything more, nor was it expecting people to exceed what they had just accomplished; it was simply feeling so complete." -- John Irving

item.title: Beth add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength." -- George Orwell

item.title: Beth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth add a quote by Chris Crutcher
item.description: "Love, in the universal sense, is unconditional acceptance. In the individual sense, the one-on-one sense, try this: we can say we love each other if my life is better because you're in it and your life is better because I'm in it. The intensity of the love is weighted by how much better." -- Chris Crutcher

item.title: Beth add a quote by Gautama Buddha
item.description: "Our life is shaped by our mind; we become what we think. Suffering follows an evil thought as the wheels of a cart follow the oxen that draws it. Our life is shaped by our mind; we become what we think. Joy follows a pure thought like a shadow that never leaves." -- Gautama Buddha

item.title: Beth add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "When you love someone, you don't want to hurt them, even if they deserve to be hurt. When you love someone, you want to hurt them, even when they don't deserve to be hurt." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Beth add a quote by Richard Russo
item.description: "Don't even the best and most fortunate of lives hint at other possibilities, at a different kind of sweetness and, yes, bitterness too? Isn't this why we can't help feeling cheated, even when we know we haven't been?" -- Richard Russo

item.title: Beth add a quote by Meg Cabot
item.description: "Someday you're really going to have to describe to me in more detail what life is like on the planet you live on. Because it sounds really great, and I'd like to visit there one day." -- Meg Cabot

item.title: Beth add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "It's not about how to achieve your dreams, it's about how to lead your life, ... If you lead your life the right way, the karma will take care of itself, the dreams will come to you." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Beth add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "Childhood is not from birth to a certain age and at a certain age. The child is grown, and puts away childish things. Childhood is the kingdom where nobody dies." -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Beth add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "And yet,to say the truth, reason and love keep little company together nowadays." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Beth add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "Personal affection is a luxury you can have only after all your enemies are eliminated. Until then, everyone you love is a hostage, sapping your courage and corrupting your judgment." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Beth add a quote by Sloane Crosley
item.description: "Life starts out with everyone clapping when you take a poo and goes downhill from there. " -- Sloane Crosley

item.title: Beth add a quote by Sloane Crosley
item.description: "We all deserve to be congratulated, but sadly that would mean there's no one left to do the congratulating." -- Sloane Crosley

item.title: Beth add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Beth add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I have a history of making decisions very quickly about men. I have always fallen in love fast and without measuring risks. I have a tendency not only to see the best in everyone, but to assume that everyone is emotionally capable of reaching his highest potential. I have fallen in love more times than I care to count with the highest potential of a man, rather than with the man himself, and I have hung on to the relationship for a long time (sometimes far too long) waiting for the man to ascend to his own greatness. Many times in romance I have been a victim of my own optimism." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Beth add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "This is a good sign, having a broken heart. It means we have tried for something." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Beth add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "In desperate love, we always invent the characters of our partners, demanding they be what we need of them, and then feeling devastated when they refuse to perform the role we created in the first place." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Beth add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "The only thing more unthinkable than leaving was staying; the only thing more impossible than staying was leaving." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Beth add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "If I love you, I will carry for you all your pain, I will assume for you all your debts (in every definition of the word), I will protect you from your own insecurity, I will protect upon you all sorts of good qualities that you have never actually cultivated in yourself and I will buy Christmas presents for your entire family. I will give you the sun and the rain, and if they are not available, I will give you a sun check and a rain check. I will give you all this and more, until I get so exhausted and depleted that the only way I can recover my energy is by becoming infatuated with someone else." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Beth add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "We search for happiness everywhere, but we are like Tolstoy's fabled beggar who spent his life sitting on a pot of gold, under him the whole time. Your treasure--your perfection--is within you already. But to claim it, you must leave the buy commotion of the mind and abandon the desires of the ego and enter into the silence of the heart." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Beth add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Dear me, how I love a library." -- Elizabeth Gilbert
